```markdown
# README for `unist-util-position`

## Overview

This package provides utilities for accessing positional information of nodes in a [unist](https://github.com/syntax-tree/unist) tree.  It's crucial for handling cases where plugins or other operations might modify or corrupt the node positions.

## Installation

This package is ESM-only.

**Node.js (v16+)**

```bash
npm install unist-util-position
```

**Deno (with esm.sh)**

```javascript
import {pointEnd, pointStart, position} from 'https://esm.sh/unist-util-position@5'
```

**Browsers (with esm.sh)**

```html
<script type="module">
  import {pointEnd, pointStart, position} from 'https://esm.sh/unist-util-position@5?bundle'
</script>
```


## Usage

```javascript
import {fromMarkdown} from 'mdast-util-from-markdown'
import {pointEnd, pointStart, position} from 'unist-util-position'

const markdown = '# foo\n\n* bar\n'
const tree = fromMarkdown(markdown)

console.log(position(tree))
console.log(pointStart(tree))
console.log(pointEnd(tree))
```

This will output:

```
{start: {line: 1, column: 1, offset: 0}, end: {line: 4, column: 1, offset: 13}}
{line: 1, column: 1, offset: 0}
{line: 4, column: 1, offset: 13}
```

## API

This package exports the following functions:

### `position(node)`

Returns the full positional information for a given node.  Returns `undefined` if no position data is found.

*   **Parameters:**
    *   `node` (Node): The unist node.
*   **Returns:**
    *   Position (or `undefined`): An object containing the starting and ending position information.


### `pointStart(node)`

Returns the starting position of a given node. Returns `undefined` if no position data is found.

*   **Parameters:**
    *   `node` (Node): The unist node.
*   **Returns:**
    *   Point (or `undefined`): An object containing the line, column, and offset of the start position.


### `pointEnd(node)`

Returns the ending position of a given node. Returns `undefined` if no position data is found.

*   **Parameters:**
    *   `node` (Node): The unist node.
*   **Returns:**
    *   Point (or `undefined`): An object containing the line, column, and offset of the end position.


## Types

The package is fully typed with TypeScript.  No additional types are exported.


## Compatibility

This package targets a compatible Node.js version of 16+.  Support for older versions might be dropped in future releases.


## Related Packages

*   [`unist-util-stringify-position`](https://github.com/syntax-tree/unist-util-stringify-position): Converts position and point data to human-readable format.
*   [`unist-util-position-from-estree`](https://github.com/syntax-tree/unist-util-position-from-estree): Converts position data from an ESTree node.
*   [`unist-util-remove-position`](https://github.com/syntax-tree/unist-util-remove-position): Removes position information from a tree.
*   [`unist-util-generated`](https://github.com/syntax-tree/unist-util-generated): Checks if a node is generated.
*   [`unist-util-source`](https://github.com/syntax-tree/unist-util-source): Retrieves the source of a node.
